content.value: Space exploration helps us understand the universe and our place within it.
The view of Earth from space gives us perspective on the fragility and uniqueness of our planet.
Studying space drives technological innovations that benefit our daily lives.
The universe is vast, containing billions of galaxies, stars, and planets.
These celestial bodies each hold important clues to the origins of the universe.
Space is a vacuum, mostly empty but filled with mysteries like black holes and dark matter.
Watch this video to learn about the scale of the universe.
Exoplanets are planets that orbit stars outside our solar system.
These distant worlds vary greatly in size, composition, and distance from their stars.
There are thousands of confirmed exoplanets, with new ones being discovered regularly.
Studying exoplanets helps us understand planetary systems and conditions for life elsewhere.
Some exoplanets might even have the right conditions to support life.

content.question: Why are exoplanets important to study?
options: They are in our solar system
They help us understand the universe
